name: NETXP EQL Suspicious Buffer overflow attempt on linux machine
description:
Rule defines a sequence detection pattern for monitoring system logs, it looks for any Kernel function call to execute a program followed by ANY program segmentation fault exception (Segmentation faults occur when a program attempts to access memory that it does not have permission to access or when it tries to access memory that does not exist. Segmentation faults can be caused by a variety of reasons, including uninitialized pointers, out-of-bounds memory access, and memory leaks) - It is a vector of performing buffer overflows within Linux kernel.

//dodatkowe audytowanie maszyn linuxa - Linux Audit Framework
author: Szymon Gluch
query:
sequence by host.hostname with maxspan=5s
  [ any where message : "*execve*" and (message: ".py" or message: ".sh" or message: ".c" or message: ".cpp")]
  [ any where message: "*segfault*"]
